data.text: This, mind you, has absolutely nothing to do with political ideology. I fervently wished for the electoral downfall of George W. Bush, but never did I think he didn’t have the best interests of the US military - or the rest of the country - at heart.
I wonder what sort of verbal gymnastics Erick Erickson, or @seanhannity, or any other commentator on the right side of the political spectrum will do to excuse #Trump?

At the time @EWErickson wrote “going to Arlington...to lay a wreath at the tomb of the unknowns has ... everything to do with a Commander in Chief who seems to not like the military showing some basic respect to the men and women, alive and dead, who have actually kept us free."
This was the same Memorial Day he was criticized for not laying a wreath at Arlington National Cemetery, though he had gone there the year before.
